title: Remove header and footer logos

requirements.text: Remove the logo image from the top header so that no logo graphic is shown at the top of the screen (keep the rest of the header content and navigation working).

quotes: Can you please remove the logo at the top of the screen and the bottom?

acceptanceCriteria: The header no longer renders the image `assets/generated/blaines-card-clinic-logo.dim_512x512.png`.
The header still displays the site name text and the desktop/mobile navigation works as before.
No layout regressions: header height/spacing looks intentional on mobile and desktop.
No console errors/warnings caused by unused imports or missing assets (e.g., remove `assetUrl` import from `SiteHeader.tsx` if no longer needed).

requirements.text: Remove the logo image from the footer so that no logo graphic is shown at the bottom of the screen (keep the rest of the footer content, quick links, and social links intact).

quotes: Can you please remove the logo at the top of the screen and the bottom?

acceptanceCriteria: The footer no longer renders the image `assets/generated/blaines-card-clinic-logo.dim_512x512.png`.
Footer text content, quick links scrolling behavior, and existing social links remain present and functional.
No layout regressions: footer branding area aligns cleanly without the logo image.
No console errors/warnings caused by unused imports or missing assets (e.g., remove `assetUrl` import from `SiteFooter.tsx` if no longer needed).

constraints: Frontend immutable paths must not be edited: `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts`, `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, `frontend/src/components/ui`.
Do not add new backend services; backend remains a single Motoko actor.
nonGoals: Do not change the TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook URLs in the footer.
Do not redesign the overall site theme or typography beyond what is necessary to remove the logo images cleanly.
Do not remove the site name text unless explicitly requested.
